Kochi roads: Corporation sitting on rest.description: KOCHI: Lack of proper planning and coordination among various agencies have left many of the city roads in a dilapidated condition. Almost a dozen roads in various parts of the city, which were dug up for laying water pipes under drinking water project mooted under Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation (Amrut) are yet to be restored, though the restoration charges were paid to the corporation almost a year ago. Now, the corporation authorities have floated tenders for the work. But, the relaying works could be started only after the monsoon is over. As a temporary measure, the corporation plans to fill the ‘major potholes’ on these roads. Still, there is apprehension regarding whether the local body can spend funds for temporary repair works. So, the authorities are exploring ways to spend funds without earning the wrath of the auditors. Subash Chandrabose Road“Many of the councillors had demanded at the council meetings that roads should be restored well ahead of monsoon. But, the corporation authorities didn’t act,” said V P Chandran, secretary, LDF parliamentary party, Kochi Corporation. According to the corporation authorities, noncompletion of pipe-laying by Kerala Water Authority delayed the tender process. “We expect that tender process for relaying many of the city roads including a dozen of roads which are to be restored following pipelaying works of Amrut will be completed in a week. Now, the mayor has given instructions to the officials to carry out filling of potholes on roads which had been dug up for pipe laying,” said P M Harris, chairperson, the standing committee for works, Kochi Corporation. “Relaying works can’t be done during rains. So, we will have to wait for the rain to subside,” he said. Opposition councillors are of the view that the local body authorities should have completed the tender process in advance and finished the work before the onset of monsoon. “The KWA had started the pipelaying work months ago and they also paid the road restoration charges. Then, the corporation could have started the tender process last year itself. But, the corporation authorities said that they couldn’t have gone for the tender process without knowing the exact length of the dug-up portions of the roads. Such details were available only after the KWA finished the pipelaying,” said Rajiv Chandrasekharan, the councillor from Ponnurunni. “In such a case, the corporation authorities could have relaid the roads in a phased manner. The stretches where pipelaying works had been completed months ago should have been repaired immediately. Then, the current situation could have avoided,” he said. At the same time, the restoration works on of a couple of roads have already been completed. “Restoration of Konthuruthy Road has been completed. I exerted constant pressure on the officials so as to get the work done on time,” said C K Peter, the councillor from Konthuruthy. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Enrica Lexie: Italian marine marries whi.description: KOCHI: Massimiliano Latorre – one of the marines accused in the infamous Enrica Lexie shooting case that resulted in the death of two fishermen off Kerala’s coast in 2012 – married his girlfriend Paola Moschetti Latorre on Saturday. The marriage was held at ‘Church of the Military Ordinariate’ in Rome. After a brain stroke, Latorre was given bail by the Supreme Court of India, which was extended several times upon his application to remain in Italy. At present, the case is being arbitrated at the International Tribunal for Law of the Sea in Germany. Salvatore Girone, the co-accused in the case, was unable to attend the wedding due to the restrictions imposed by the international tribunal. However, he posted a message to Girone on Facebook: “Dear Salvo, today we will not be able to celebrate mine and Paola’s wedding with you, but I assure you that even if you are not physically present, you, Vania, Michele and Martina, will be with us. I hope we can do everything very soon. You and I have lived all our moments and after the tears we now hope the smiles arrive my brother...” On February 15, 2012, two fishermen, Valentine Jalastine and Ajeesh Pink, were shot dead on fishing boat St Antony by Italian oil tanker Enrica Lexie’s guards Latorre and Girone. Italian owners of the tanker had hired them after Savina Caylyn, a sister ship of Enrica Lexie, was captured by Somali pirates in February 2011, while it was on its way to Pasir Gudang in Malaysia with crude oil from Port Bashayer in Sudan. Saju was a warm and caring person: Kin.description: ALAPPUZHA: Saju Samuel’s family is in a state of shock after hearing about his murder during a robbery attempt at his workplace in Nashik. His brother Suju Samuel was at a loss for words when he heard the news. “Mother used to say he was just like dad, always a positive and cheerful person. I am still in shock… I don’t know what to say,” he said. His father-in-law P Joy, a pastor, said the family was planning to visit Saju in Navi Mumbai to celebrate the first birthday of his son Jeremy on August 16. “My daughter is a widow and my grandchild lost his father. I don’t know how to explain my pain right now. My daughter gave birth during the floods in 2018. She was admitted at a private hospital in Thiruvalla on August 14 and Jeremy was born on August 16. Saju couldn’t come home due to floods. He came at the end of August. He returned in September and December. He returned to Mumbai with his wife and kid this January,” he said. Saju, the elder son of Samuel MG and Saramma, was born at Arunoottimangalam, Mavelikkara. He spent his childhood in Gujarat where Samuel worked as an engineer with a private seafood exporting firm. He completed his high school education from St Mary’s High School, Veraval, Gujarat and later did his Plus Two at Bishop Moore HSS, Mavelikkara. He then finished his engineering from Maria College of Engineering and Technology, Marthandam, Tamil Nadu and worked in various private firms in Bengaluru. Two years ago, he joined Muthoot Finance Ltd in Gujarat. Saju, who was working as the system administrator at Muthoot Finance Ltd, married Jaicey Joy on May 18, 2017. After the wedding, they went to Gujarat. His wife returned home in March 2018 after she became pregnant. He was transferred to Mumbai in June 2018. Family members reminisced how he was a calm, upright and person. “My brother studied and spent most of his life outside Kerala and hence did not have many friends here,” said Suju. “He would always come home during vacations. Though he was the silent type, he was our leader. He always did the right thing. He cared for us when we sustained injuries during playtime and even took us to hospital. After hearing about the incident, I can’t accept the same,” said Sherin Shaji, his cousin. Suju recalled the family’s relocation to Chennai in 2012. “My father became the engineer at another seafood export company in Chennai. In 2016, he had an accident and all of us returned to Mavelikkara. However, Saju was not here and came during holidays. Our father died in 2017,” he said. BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

A soothing break was necessary, says cir.description: Kochi: Circle inspector V S Navas, who went incommunicado on Thursday after an argument with a senior officer and returned on Saturday after 44 hours, told reporters that he would act according to the department’s directions. On Friday, Navas’s wife had said that her husband went incommunicado after facing harassment from a senior officer. However, Navas is yet to say anything against his superiors in public on his return. He said that a break was necessary for peace of mind. “When we have troubles, we either cry or will approach someone for comfort or we seek solitude. I wanted some solitude so that I can get relaxed. I have been living mechanically for long. Our soul needs some food, like travel, talking with friends, meeting our Guru, reading good books, listening to music, etc. Some others resort to alcohol or drugs, which I can’t,” Navas told reporters on Sunday.  Navas had gone incommunicado after an argument with ACP P S Suresh. He was transferred to Mattancherry before he went incommunicado, however, sources said that the posting would happen only after the DCP completes the probe and submits a report to the higher ups. “The probe will be conducted by analysing documents and records. We will maintain a status-quo regarding the CI’s posting. He will be meeting the IG on Monday. Senior officers, including the DGP, will take a call on his posting. The newly-appointed CI will take charge at Ernakulam Central while temporary arrangements will be made at Mattancherry,” said a senior officer. Meanwhile, experts said that both officers are likely to face disciplinary action. Officers said that even if there was pressure within the force, officers should be able to withstand them. “Now, the officer concerned is most likely to get a memo for unauthorized absence. What he should have done was to report to his senior, if another officer had used unparliamentary language over the wireless. There would be a recording of it and there would be an action for sure,” said Rtd SP George Joseph. However, officers close to Navas said that he was not someone who bows to pressure. “I know him for years. He has struggled so much over the years. If he wanted to run away, he would have done it much earlier. This means that pressure on him would have been so intense that he would have reached a breaking point,” said an officer. Kerala police to get more tech teeth.description: KOCHI: After the induction of country’s first humanoid Robocop (KP-BOT), the Kerala police may soon get more innovative gear in its arsenal such as ‘smart handcuff’ with intelligent tracking devices and AI-based software that identifies suspects from CCTV footage. More products are likely to emerge from the innovation zone of startups which is being set up by the Kerala Startup Mission (KSUM) for the state police. The KSUM had called for proposals from startups with potential products for the force and more than 40 startups from various parts of the country have come forward. “Currently, startups are only providing software support to the Cyberdome project. The innovation zone will take it beyond that and provide hardware too,” KSUM CEO Saji Gopinath said. Chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan and DGP Loknath Behera are keen to take the project forward. “The cut-off date for receiving the applications was June 15 and more than 40 startups from across the country responded. The potential-product startups will be shortlisted in a week,” the KSUM CEO said. The ‘smart handcuff’ has been developed by startup Technorip Innovations, incubated at Kochi Maker Village. “It has an intelligent tracking device with geographic information system (GIS) that can be connected to phones to track culprits. We are already engaged with the police department since the national police conference last year and received Rs 8.5 lakh productivisation fund from KSUM. Now, we have applied with KSUM to pitch in this product demo for the police,” said Arun PM, founder CEO of Technorip who has developed it with chief tech officer Tom Victor. Another startup Neuroplex, incubated with KSUM, has developed the AI-based software to identify suspects from CCTV recordings or live footage. “We have developed a product called ‘EyesAge’ which is an AI-based software which can detect/identify a suspect or missing person from CCTV recordings or live footage and can offer visual alert,” Neuroplex founder/director Savio Victor said. \u2018KC(M)\u2019s state committee meeti.description: KOTTAYAM: The infighting in Kerala Congress(M) has reached tipping point with the Jose K Mani group announcing that the state committee meeting of the party to elect a new chairman will be held on Sunday. According to party vice chairman Jose K Mani, the meeting will be held at the CSI retreat centre at 2pm and the notices have been served also to the members belonging to the rival faction led by P J Joseph, the party's acting chairman. Sources close to Joseph said that he will not be taking part in the meeting. Mani said that the constitution of the party clearly says that the chairman of the party has to be elected by the state committee. A letter signed by 127 state committee members, demanding that the meeting be held, has been submitted to the working chairman, deputy chairman and vice chairman on June 3. The party's constitution says that meeting has to be called when 1/4th of the state committee demands for it. Meanwhile, Joseph said: "Only the working chairman, who has the powers of chairman, has the right to call the state committee. The meeting called by Mani is illegal and not binding according to the party's constitution." Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha poll results reflect believers.description: KOTTAYAM: The NSS leadership, which had not yet expressed its opinion about the Lok Sabha election results, has come out with its view in the editorial of the latest edition of Services, the mouthpiece of NSS. The editorial said that the election results was a setback for those who hurt the feelings of believers. The results in the state reflect the protest of the faithful against the LDF government for failing to protect their faith and also against the Central government, which failed to resolve the issue. The result was the reaction of believers, irrespective of caste and religion, for insulting Lord Ayyappa. The Constitution assures freedom for religious faith and related activities. Governments are bound to protect freedom of religion and faith. The state-central governments should realize that there was no relevance for political stance in such situations. The editorial also said that even the NDA was shocked by the victory of the Congress-led UDF. The defeat in Alappuzha, the lone seat which the UDF lost, was due to some differences in the front in that constituency, it said. The editorial also said that the thumping win of the NDA in pther parts of the country was due to the front's election tactics. The Congress and its allies failed to foresee it., it said. Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Govt plans to rehabilitate residents in.description: Malappuram: Assembly speaker P Sreeramakrishnan, who visited coastal areas of Ponnani where sea erosion wreaked havoc, has announced that the government would permanently rehabilitate residents in the coastal area within one year. Protest was brewing among residents of the coastal areas in Ponnani taluk as more than hundred houses were completely and partially damaged in the sea erosion after the onset of South-West monsoon. Speaker, who visited the region on Saturday along with district collector Amit Meena, local body members and officials, said that the rehabilitation schemes for the residents of the coastal region would be implemented under different housing projects of the state government. “The government is aiming to find a permanent solution for the sea erosion issues in the region, instead of an eyewash. As a temporary measure, authorities would take immediate measures to complete the ongoing construction of seawall in the areas,” the speaker said. He added that the district collector would chalk out a plan to immediately implement different projects announced by the government for families who are facing sea erosion issues. As per the official estimate of revenue authorities, 21 houses were completely damaged in sea erosion in Ponnani taluk area. As many as 99 houses were partially damaged and the rest of the houses are on the verge of being washed away. Several trees, including more than hundred coconut trees, were also washed away in the strong waves. Coastal areas of Ponnani from Azheekal to Puthupponani and areas in Perumbadappu and Veliyankode grama panchayats are facing severe issues due to fierce waves. After the report on sea erosion, revenue authorities had opened relief camps at ALP School Anappadi, Fisheries School and Anakath School in Veliyankode, to shift families from the coastal areas. Recently, construction of a seawall was started in the light house region of Ponnani following the decision taken at an emergency meeting held in the chamber of speaker. The government has already earmarked Rs 65 lakh for the wall construction. A 100-m-long seawall would be constructed in the northern side of the light house, where high tides pose serious threat to residential buildings. Corruption will not be tolerated at any.description: Palakkad: Chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan has said that the LDF government would not tolerate corruption in the state. “If corruption is found anywhere strict action will be taken and the government will give all support to end corruption,” Vijayan said. Inaugurating the new office complex of the district vigilance & anti-corruption bureau (VACB) here on Sunday, the chief minister said the government had given a free hand for the vigilance to function independently. “Government will not interfere in their work,” he added. He said more officials would be appointed to make the work of vigilance more effective. “The cases charged by vigilance are handled very seriously and they are also given the legal support in conducting cases against corruption. Government has taken into account the general feeling of people against corruption in the state,” the CM said. The first phase of the 14,000 sq ft building was completed at a cost of Rs 1.73 crore and the second and third phase works will start soon. The event was presided over by minister for welfare of scheduled caste and scheduled tribes A K Balan. The keynote address was delivered by minister for water resources K Krishnankutty. It was attended by V K Sreekantan, MP-elect; Shafi Parambil, MLA, district panchayat president K Santhakumari; ADGP and VACB director K Karthi; district collector D Balamurali among others. Slain cop\u2019s mom, son say Ajas threa.description: ALAPPUZHA: The body of civil police officer Soumya Pushpakaran, who was brutally murdered, was handed over to her kin after completing legal and medical examinations at Alappuzha Medical College Hospital at 2pm on Sunday. It has been shifted to the morgue of a private hospital at her native place, Oachira in Kollam. Cremation would take place after the arrival of her husband Sajeev, who is working in Libya, on Tuesday, said police. Soumya , who was working at Vallikunnam police station, was hacked and set ablaze by N A Ajas (33), a civil police officer attached to Aluva traffic police station, on Saturday near her home at Thekkemuri in Vallikunnam grama panchayat. Soumya was working at Vallikunnam police stationAjas, who sustained over 40% burns, has been admitted to Alappuzha Medical College Hospital. Though police arrived at the hospital with magistrate to record his on Saturday night, he was not able to speak. The police have not registered his arrest still Sunday evening. Meanwhile, Soumya’s mother Indira and elder son Rishikesh told media that Ajas had threatened and attacked her many times.  “Amma (Soumya) had told me if anything happens to her, I should tell police that Ajas is responsible. She told me that the man had threatened her several times over phone. My father is unaware of these incidents,’’ Rishikesh said. According to Indira, “Ajas killed her after she turned down his marriage proposal. He had threatened to kill her and her husband many times. He had beaten her up with shoes. When I had offered to interfere, she said it might create more trouble. She had also informed Vallikunnam sub-inspector about the issue three months ago.” However, Vallikunnam sub-inspector Shaiju Ebrahim said he was not informed. He added that Indira herself told him on Sunday that they did not inform police due to fear. He said Sowmya had borrowed Rs 1.25 lakh from Ajas. When she returned the money, Ajas did not accept it and demanded to marry him. She transferred the money to his account. But he sent it back to her account. Following this, Sowmya and Indira asked him to collect the money in person at KSRTC bus station, Ernakulam in May. Though he came to meet them, he refused to take the money back and dropped the duo at Clappana. When things started going out of hands, Sowmya blocked his number. But Ajas continued to stalk her from other numbers. Indira, too, had requested Ajas not to disturb her daughter, the officer said. Soumya had joined Kerala Police in 2014. She was trained under Ajas for around three months. They went on to become friends through social media, said her friends. Her husband was home a month ago on vacation. Apart from Rishikesh (Class VII), the couple has another son, Adhisesh (Class V) and a three-and-a-half-year-old daughter, Ridhika. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tourist drowns at Anakkulam.description: Idukki: A tourist drowned in the Anakkulam river near Mankulam in the district on Sunday. The deceased has been identified as Midhun Krishna (23) of Peringamala in Thiruvananthapuram. Police said the incident occurred around 2pm when four tourists were bathing in the river near Valiyaparakkutty. Along with Krishna, another member of the gang Sanu also fell into deep water. Though the other two, Akhil and Jyothish, rushed to the spot, they could rescue only Sanu. “The local residents later recovered Krishna. Though he was rushed to a private hospital, doctors declared him brought dead. The body was shifted to Adimali taluk hospital for postmortem. Krishna was an employee at the casualty wing of Kolenchery medical college. The four-member team reached Mankulam on Saturday,” said police. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nBhama's attire at Lalu Alex's son's we.description: Lalu Alex’s son Ben Alex’s wedding pictures at a register office had flooded the internet recently.  Now the couple had an official ceremony which took place at the Holy Kings Knanaya Church at Piravom recently. Ben and Meenu Cyril had a traditional church wedding, according to Knanaya customs. Quite a few from the film industry dropped in to wish the couple, and actress Bhama turned up in a green full length gown. With fringed hair and light make up, she was a ravishing presence at the function.  What surprised all was a visit from Mammootty! Jayaram came with Parvathy and Kalidas, Parvathy looking ethereal in an ochre sari. Dileep and Bhama arrived alone, Bhama sporting a green silk gown with gold detailing. We also spotted actors Chippy, Captain Raju and Kunjan, among others. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Doctors strike.description: Healthcare in hospitals across the country is set for a major disruption on Monday with   Indian Medical Association   deciding to withdraw non-essential services for a day to express solidarity with their striking colleagues in Bengal. However, in a move that may bring some relief to patients in New Delhi, AIIMS resident doctors have decided not to join the strike. But those in Safdarjung Hospital, Lady Hardinge Medical College, RML Hospital and others will skip work. In Kolkata on Sunday, the agitating doctors said they were ready to meet Mamata Banerjee "anytime and anywhere". The government proposed a 3pm meeting at the state secretariat on Monday. The doctors were reportedly ready to accept the proposal. IMA strike to cripple OPDs todayEarlier, the junior doctors had insisted that the meeting cannot be held behind closed doors and the media should be allowed to telecast it live. The state government, however, cited legalities and constitutional propriety, which prevent such meetings from being held under public glare. The doctors were ready to accept the government's request, sources indicated late Sunday, which would pave the way for "across-the-table" discussions between the protesters and the chief minister. "We are very hopeful for the meeting in Nabanna (state secretariat) on Monday," a senior official, mediating for the state, said. "We have explained to them that given the issues involved, mainly legal, administrative and security-related, it is impossible for the state government to agree to their demand for an open-door meeting in presence of the media. The CM is also sworn to an oath of secrecy in some such matters. We have explained they have every right to speak to media afterwards, much like the norm in all such cases. They have agreed to it," he said. Under pressure from several quarters, including the seniors in the medical fraternity, the junior doctors in Kolkata held a four-hour general body meeting at NRS Hospital. The meeting appeared to split three ways. While a section of doctors agreed to have the meeting at Nabanna, another section stressed on Raj Bhavan as the venue, while the remaining stuck to their demand for NRS Hospital. Pressure further mounted on the striking doctors to find a solution to the standoff. At 3.30pm, a group of doctors announced their stand. "We are hopeful that our CM will be considerate enough to solve the problems that the state is facing in the healthcare sector currently," they said in a statement while refusing to accept any question from the media. "We leave the decision to choose the venue to the honourable CM, but it should accommodate representatives of all medical colleges of West Bengal in sufficient numbers," the statement read. They expressed willingness to join work, "as early as possible in the best interest of the common people once our demands are addressed". Five arrested in Thripunithura murder ca.description: KOCHI: Two days after Dinesh Divakaran, a 35-year-year old man, was stabbed to death in Vennikulam, Thripunithura police arrested five persons in connection with the murder. The arrested persons were identified as Athul (21) of Kolenchery, Sooraj (20) of Tripunithura, Ashokan(22) of Mulanthhruthy, Ratheesh (21) of Pullepady and Hareesh (28) of Tripunithura. According to the police, murder was in retaliation to a fight picked up between the accused and some of the residents, including Dinesh in Vennikulam on Thursday night. They were nabbed after the police traced them using the video footages collected from CCTC cameras near the murder spot. The police said that the accused were drug addicts and have had occasional gatherings at one of the accused, Hareesh’s, rented house in Vennikulam. On Thursday night the five member gang was on their way to Hareesh's house and one of their bikes got punctured. Another accused, Sooraj, took the bike to a puncture shop near petrol bunk in Chottanikkara while the others walked to Vennikkulam. After seeing the gang in drunken state, some of the residents near Vennikkulam high school questioned them. After a brief quarrel they reached Hareesh's house. Later when Sooraj returned, he along with Athul went to Vennikulam with a knife and stabbed Dinesh, who was alone then, and fled from the scene. Chottanikkara police during the night combing spotted Dinesh in a pool of blood. Though he was rushed nearby hospital, doctors declared him brought dead. We aim for quick completion of probe, sa.description: KOCHI: Vigilance and anti-corruption bureau (VACB) inspector general H Venkatesh said the bureau was determined to find the whole gamut of the Palarivattom flyover scam. He added that the investigation was still in its initial stage and that they were in the process of analysing documents in connection with the flyover construction. “The investigation is going on briskly. Routine raids and seizures are happening as part of the probe. The FIR was registered last week we are aiming for a quick completion of the probe,” said Venkatesh. Meanwhile, official sources said the department would scrutinise documents and account details collected during a raid at the contractor’s office and residence. “We are able to get documents from government departments. The raids on Friday was to seize the documents from the private property. All the seized documents would be analysed to find out what all lapses have happened. Role of each individual connected with the construction that has led to a lapse would be brought to the fore through a thorough probe,” said an officer. The raids on Friday started at 3.30pm and continued till 8pm. Two teams of VACB unit conducted raids at the regional office of RDS Project Limited, the New-Delhi based firm that got the contract of constructing Palarivattom flyover, at Panampilly Nagar and an apartment owned by the company MD, Sumit Goyal, at Kakkanad. Details regarding the bank transaction and fund utilized for the flyover construction have been recovered. The flyover has been closed to traffic since May 1 as part of restoration works. Magisterial powers to police: Plea withd.description: KOCHI: A petition filed before Kerala high court questioning LDF government’s move to grant magisterial powers to police commissioners of Kochi and Thiruvananthapuram by establishing commissionerates was withdrawn during admission hearing on Friday. A division bench comprising chief justice Hrishikesh Roy and justice AK Jayasankaran Nambiar considered a petition (WP-C No. 16237/2019) filed by P Muraleedharan of Pandit Karuppan Road at Mattummal near Thevara in Kochi. At the hearing, the court said it has limitations in interfering with the policy decisions of the government and that it can do so only when such a decision is against public interest. It is seen that it is a matter that has been considered by various governments, the court noted. Responding to the petitioner’s demand that a Commission of Inquiry should be appointed to identify areas with high crime rate, the court asked how it can ask the government to take a policy decision only after receiving the report of an enquiry commission. The court also asked the petitioner’s counsel to explain where all in India were commissionerates established after conducting an enquiry by a Commission of Inquiry. As the petitioner’s counsel was not able to provide a reply, the court said a petition should be filed only if adequate records and information are available. The court also warned that it would impose a fine on the petitioner for raising baseless arguments. Following the court’s warning, the petitioner’s counsel sought permission for withdrawing the plea and the court recorded the petition as dismissed as withdrawn. It was alleged in the petition that no serious study was conducted by the government prior to deciding for establishing commissionerates at Kochi and Thiruvananthapuram by granting magisterial powers to police commissioners. No serious study was conducted regarding the needs, location, and nature of crimes and where the commissionerates should be located, the petitioner had contended. Stating that main offences occur and the culprits in them escape through airports, railway stations, centres of interstate transport operations, and places with access by sea, the object of establishing a commissionerate can be achieved only by bringing more areas under it on the basis of occurrence of crimes, the petition had stated while seeking a probe by a Commission of Inquiry prior to establishing the commissionerates. Sea erosion affects beach tourism in Kan.description: Kannur: Though the monsoon is not that strong this time, the coastal erosion is causing huge concern and most of the coastal region is badly affected. Also, the entry for visitors is restricted in most of the beaches in the district, which has affected the people depending on local tourism as well. Since the last few days, the sea is rough and in many places the entire beach has been washed away. One of the worst affected beaches is at Payyambalam, where the sea has become so rough that half the beach is washed off and a ‘photo frame’ installed there as a means of attracting tourists has been removed. Muzhappilangad, the drive-in beach in the district, is also facing the same problem and, there is a restriction on visitors and no vehicles are permitted there now. Though the damage to the beaches could affect the tourism potential of the district, it is hoped that they would be back to normal in a few weeks according to the tourism authorities. “Normally, the sand that the sea take away would be deposited back in a few weeks,” said district tourism promotion council (DTPC) secretary Jitheesh Jose. He said it was not advisable to have any kind of manual intervention to improve the beaches, as erosion is a natural phenomenon. According to Muhammed Mahir, who is managing a beach at Chootad near Pazhyangadi, taken on lease from the DTPC, the number of visitors has come down drastically after the rain alert. “Many people think that it is closed and not safe to visit here. So now 20-30 people come here compared to 500-600 on a normal day. We find it difficult to meet the expenses and manage the beach and the park,” he said. The residential areas along the coastal region are the worst affected, as the rough sea and erosion are posing threat to residents, said C Sameer, the councillor from Ayikkara in Kannur corporation. Rs 12-crore project to prevent coastal erosion: Revenue minister E Chandrasekharan has said a Rs 12-crore project would be implemented in Kasaragod to preventing coastal erosion. The minister, who visited Musodi, a coastal area in the district, which experienced erosion due to rough sea and giant waves since the onset of monsoon, on Saturday, said that temporary measures such as placing geo bags to check coastal erosion in the district, for which Rs 1 crore would be released. Rs 12 crore would be sanctioned for the long-term works to check the sea erosion, said the minister. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Seniors harassed him: Cop's wife.description: KOCHI: Even as other officers maintained that the senior officer's outburst - after which central CI VS Navas went incommunicado - was 'routine', Navas's wife told the media that her husband was a victim of harassment. She complained of apathy after she approached senior officers with a complaint. But, senior officers said the outburst cannot be termed as harassment as Navas was not answering his phone. "This inspector has a good track record. But, if an officer is not keeping his senior in the loop, it is not proper conduct. We will probe the reason behind his disappearance later. The priority is to find him first," said a senior officer. She claimed that he was under pressure to register fake cases before Wednesday's incident and had to put up with personal insults. "He said there was a big issue with ACP and insisted that I shouldn't ask anything. He was watching TV early in the morning and was gone. I couldn't reach any of the officers (after the complaint). They haven't contacted me either. Priority is to get my husband back," she said. Meanwhile, Kerala Police on Friday night uploaded a photo of Navas on its official Facebook page saying that he was missing. Within 40 minutes, the post received 649 comments and 2,500 shares. The wife had filed a petition with commissioner Vijay Sakhare and talked to DCP J Poonguzhali. "She told me that he had withdrawn money from an ATM and that he would return in 10 days. When I asked who told her so, she switched the topic and told me to take care of my children. They are not kids who can be pacified just like that," she said. She was relieved after south police showed her a CCTV footage of Navas in a KSRTC bus to Kollam. The woman also mailed a petition to the chief minister and demanded a probe. Navas had a heated exchange with Ernakulam ACP PS Suresh over the wireless on Wednesday night. Suresh said he only sought an explanation for his absence during a roll call. Meanwhile, the last report about the missing officer came from Kollam where he was seen alighting from a KSRTC bus. Another CCTV footage showed him leaving the car of another officer near Kayamkulam bus stand. He travelled between Cherthala and Kayamkulam in the car and reportedly took the bus to Kollam. Police had also received a CCTV footage of him withdrawing cash from an ATM near Thevara. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

This approach road is at the mercy of ba.description: KOCHI: If bandicoots have their way, it would not take long for the approach road of Vaduthala -Chittoor bridge to collapse. The rodents have already dug deep burrows along the sides of the approach road. It has resulted in the leaking of the red sand which forms the foundation of the approach road. A large hole has formed on the road indicating an imminent disaster. A three-member team of engineers from PWD (Bridges) inspected the site on Friday and have sent a mail to the Kochi corporation demanding immediate rectification of the damages on the approach road. According to officials, large burrows were found along a 60m stretch. “The stretch of the approach road where the hole was formed belongs to Kochi corporation. The damages are the handiwork of bandicoots. The local body should immediately stop dumping of waste near the approach road of the bridge,” said an assistant engineer. The officer, however, said that the bridge is in good condition. Speaking about the broken and damaged slabs on footpath attached to the bridge, she said that they had decided to take an estimate required for the repair works. “Once we get the administrative sanction for repair works of the bridge, we will undertake it,” she said. According to PWD, while it is their responsibility to maintain the road which falls within the limits of Cheranalloor panchayat (or Chittoor side), the Kochi corporation is bound to undertake repair works on the stretch of the road which falls within the limits of the local body. However, the PWD’s directions have not gone down well with the local body. The corporation maintains that as the bridge belongs to PWD they would have to undertake the repair works. O P Sunil, who represents Vaduthala East division in the Kochi corporation council said the corporation wanted PWD to execute the repair work as the “bridge is their asset”. He said waste from three divisions of the local body gets dumped on the sides of the approach road. “It is a collection point. By 11 am the waste is segregated and sent to the waste dump at Brahmapuram,” adding that the local body did not allow accumulation of waste on the sides of the approach road. However, a look around clearly indicates that garbage is being thrown around carelessly. Garbage, which includes plastic and other non-biodegradable waste, is heaped on the old bridge, which stands adjacent to the new Vaduthala -Chittoor bridge. Domestic animals like goats and cows can be seen feeding on the waste. Pungent smell, which emits from the waste dump engulfs the region. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nun rape case: Probe officer will remain.description: KOTTAYAM: The government has cancelled the transfer of Vaikom DSP K Subhash to Idukki and issued fresh orders posting him in the Kottayam district itself. He will be joining the District Crime Records Bureau. Earlier, he was transferred to Vigilance and Anti-corruption Bureau in Idukki. The transfer of the officer had raised criticism as he was the chief investigating officer in the nun rape case in which Bishop Franco Mulakkal was arrested. Many including the fellow nuns of the survivor nun had questioned the move to transfer him out of the district when the trial in the case was about to start. Earlier, Kottayam SP Harisankar who had supervised the investigation in the case was also transferred. The transfer of both these officers at the onset of the trial in the case was looked upon with suspicion by the nuns. The prosecution was also relieved as the DSP Subhash will be easily available here during the trial of the case. Save Our Sisters (SOS) forum had alleged the involvement of influential hands in the transfer of the officers. Convenor Felix J Pulludan had said that the unexpected transfer came at a time when the SOS was preventing the witnesses being influenced. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nAmalda Liz looks like a work of art in.description: Actress Amalda Liz, who impressed us right through her first film 'Kammattippadam,' was recently seen in Kochi setting the ramp ablaze in a fashion show. Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Brain dead woman\u2019s organs donated.description: KOCHI: Nibeya Joseph, a 25-year-old nurse, gave a new lease of life to six persons after her family decided to donate her organs. Nibeya was declared brain dead at Aster Medcity on Friday. Nibeya along with her brother Nikhil Joseph was admitted at the hospital on Monday after they suffered critical injuries in a road accident. Her heart and one kidney were transplanted into patients admitted at Kottayam Medical College. While liver was transplanted into a patient at Aster Medcity, pancreas and the other kidney were donated to patients at Amrita Institute of Medical Sciences. The cornea was donated to Giridhar Eye Institute. All the recipients were selected from the patients registered with the Kerala Network for Organ Sharing (KNOS) Mrithasanjeevani. Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Finish road work in one year: High court.description: KOCHI: The high court has ordered the state government to complete the widening of Thammanam-Pulleppady Road into a four-lane road within a year. The time limit was fixed by Justice Shaji P Chaly after considering a petition filed by Dr Priyarenjini S of Kadavanthra through advocate K P Pradeep. The work is pending as PWD Roads division declined to undertake the work and the city corporation, which owns the road, did not have the required funds. In the judgment, the court criticized the government for failing to take steps to complete the project envisioned in June 2015 even after starting to collect Re 1 cess on sale of petrol and diesel to pool the fund for this project and other projects included in district flagship infrastructure projects (DFIP). In a meeting held in July 2017, PWD minister had stated that PWD did not intend to undertake the work. "Having collected the said fund, the state government should have made every effort and endeavour to implement the project at a faster pace in order to ventilate the grievances of the residents of Kochi city, and other people visiting Kochi. It is quite disheartening to note from the report submitted by the district collector, that the PWD had decided not to take up the project," the court observed The government is also duty bound to discharge the duties and obligations undertaken by it as per the DFIP order by treating it as a promise extended by the government to the public, the judgment said. "It also has the characteristics of a firm offer made by the government to the public by charging additional sales tax at the rate of Re 1 per litre against the sale of petrol and diesel. The public has accepted the offer by paying the additional tax and the government is, therefore, not at liberty to withdraw from the offer," the court added. Parliament Session.description: NEW DELHI: The first session of the 17th Lok Sabha will commence from Monday during which the passage of the Union Budget and other key legislations such as triple talaq will be on top of the agenda for the government. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, chairing an all-party meeting on the eve of the first session of the new Lok Sabha, invited heads of all parties to a meeting on June 19 to discuss the "one nation, one election" issue and other important matters. Noting that there are many new faces in this Lok Sabha, PM Modi said the first session of the lower house of Parliament should begin with "fresh zeal and new thinking". At the all-party meeting, the Congress raised with the government issues of unemployment, farmers distress, drought, and press freedom, while also calling for early conduct of assembly polls in Jammu and Kashmir. The opposition parties demanded discussion on all such issues in Parliament, with the Congress asserting that it is still a "fight of ideologies". Prime Minister Modi, defence minister Rajnath Singh, leader of opposition in the Rajya Sabha Ghulam Nabi Azad, Congress lawmakers Adhir Ranjan Choudhary, K Suresh, National Conference leader Farooq Abdullah and TMC leader Derek O'Brien were present at the meeting. The BJP also held its parliamentary party meet on Sunday with Prime Minister Modi assuring Indians that his government will be at the forefront of facilitating legislation that manifests the spirit of "sabka saath, sabka vikas, sabka vishwas". A day before the first session of the newly-constituted 17th Lok Sabha, a meeting of the NDA was also held here. The government had promulgated as many as 10 ordinances for the session which ends on July 26 and will have 30 sittings. The first two days of the session will be used for administering oath of office to all Lok Sabha MPs. The oath will be administered by protem Speaker Virender Kumar. The Speaker will be elected on June 19 and the next day the President will address a joint sitting of both Houses. The budget will be introduced on July 5. Among the bills that will be introduced, the one on triple talaq could be a contentious one between the government and the opposition. Addressing the media after the all-party meeting, parliamentary affairs minister Prahlad Joshi said the Prime Minister urged leaders of all parties to "introspect whether members of Parliament are able to fulfil people's aspirations as their representatives and the manner in which last two years of the 16th Lok Sabha were wasted". An all-party meeting is a customary procedure before the beginning of every session of Parliament to ensure its smooth functioning. Joshi said the government has requested all parties, especially the opposition, for their cooperation for the smooth functioning of both Houses of Parliament. In order to build esprit de corps, PM Modi has invited presidents of all those parties who have an MP either in Lok Sabha or Rajya Sabha for a meeting on June 19. The meeting has been called to discuss "one nation, one election" issue, celebrations of 75 years of India's Independence in 2022 and 150 years of Mahatma Gandhi's birth anniversary this year, he said. It will be followed by a dinner meeting with all MPs of both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha on June 20 to freely interact and exchange views with the government, Joshi said, adding that these two novel initiatives would go a long way in building team spirit among all parliamentarians. Anti-nuclear activist SP Udaykumar calls.description: KOCHI: Reiterating solidarity with the Puthuvype residents who protest against the proposed Indian Oil Corporation’s LPG terminal, anti-nuclear activist SP Udayakumar said that the protesters should have to change their strategy by bringing together people from other states where similar issues are fought. He was addressing the residents here after inaugurating the second anniversary of police Lathi Charge incident at Puthuvype, during a protest against the constructions of IOC terminal, on Sunday evening. “There is a need to increase the communication between Keralites and Tamilians who are fighting socially relevant issues like the IOC Terminal, Alappad mining, Koodankulam nuclear power plant, Thoothukudi Sterlite plants etc. Not many Tamils or Keralites know much about all these problems and there is a need for extending solidarity with each other and fight together. Together we can form an indomitable power against the corporate-oriented development supported by changing governments. It is inevitable as Kerala and Tamil Nadu are the only states free from Fascist clutches, as proven by the recent Lok Sabha polls,” he said. It was on June 18, 2018, protests against the upcoming LPG import terminal at Puthuvype snowballed into a clash between local residents and the police leading to lathi charge that injured more than a dozen protesters. The meeting was attended by MB Jaya Ghosh, chairman, Puthuvype LPG Terminal Virudha Janakeeya Samara Samiti, activists CR Neelakandan, PR Pouran etc. The Samiti said that the protest will continue against the government’s decision to go ahead with the project. Narendra Modi.description: NEW DELHI: PM Narendra Modi used the first all-party meeting called after the elections to push for his "One Nation, One Election" idea at a meeting of leaders of political parties to be held on June 19. Making the announcement at the usual meeting of political parties called on the eve of the 17th Lok Sabha convening on Monday, Modi said Parliament should begin with "fresh zeal and new thinking". Wednesday's meeting is to also discuss how Parliament can be made more productive. Modi's invite extends to presidents of all the parties with presence in Parliament. Besides "One Nation, One Election", the meeting would discuss celebration of 75 years of India's Independence in 2022 and 150 years of Mahatma Gandhi's birth anniversary this year, parliamentary affairs minister Pralhad Joshi said. Spl team to probe \u2018dubious\u2019 la.description: Idukki: Idukki district collector H Dineshan has constituted a special team to probe the dubious land deals at Chinnakkanal near Munnar in Idukki. “The team, led by Devikulam sub-collector Renju Raj will begin its work from Monday. The probe is likely to last for three months,” said Dineshan. The team will probe all cases related to land encroachments and forged titles, including the alleged RTS Group encroachment in Chinnakkanal, said the collector. “The team will probe each encroachment in the region and take strict action. The team has been authorized to take immediate action if any government official is found to be involved in the land grabs,” said Dineshan. It was alleged that a Delhi-based company, RTS Group, which is also involved in the Palarivattam flyover row, has encroached over 3.5 hectares of government land at Chinnakkanal. The land deal took place in 2002 and the special task force formed by the former CM V S Achuthanandan had found it was an encroached government land. But the company continues to pay the land tax and others, said revenue sources. Recently, a group of landless plantation workers encroached the land and erected sheds on the land. CPI local leadership raised their support to the agitation. “The land mafia encroach government land and then it is sold to companies or persons by forging the documents. The documents are forged with the help of revenue officials,” said a revenue department source. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Monsoon brings back flood fears.description: The monsoon rains that hit Kerala shores after a summer that recorded a temperature rise of nearly 3.9 degree C above normal should have been considered a huge relief for Malayalis. But while many went around romancing the first monsoon showers of the year and clicking selfies, some felt unwelcoming about the rains, and in fact were reduced to anxiety. Research student Sooraj H from Kochi was one such. He had been trapped in Kochi during the unprecedented floods of August and now he can barely look out of the window without feeling restless and breaking into palpitations. For the past two months, he has also been experiencing severe mood swings and sleeplessness and it had begun to affect his work and relationship. Sooraj, who now stays alone in the city, sought help from his friends and explained how his anxiety is affecting his life. “I tried my best to stay calm, but I lost my control when the Orange Alert and low pressure at sea were announced. Also, the video that has been doing the rounds of the flooding at Fort Kochi beach, where I used to hang out, added to my stress,” he says. He approached a psychologist. “I feel much better now as I have understood what is happening to me.” In 2018, Kerala saw its worst monsoon since 1924, as the state’s 44 rivers ran wild, and left over 3.1 lakh homeless; 1,568 relief camps were opened, 432 people died, and several went missing. The Kerala government reported that one-sixth of the state’s population were directly affected by the unexpected natural disaster, causing them mental and physical trauma. As the disaster-affected people in Kerala are trying hard to rebuild their lives, experts say that many are being silently eaten up by the post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), acute stress reaction and acute mental exertion, called anniversary reaction, that could hit one around the time the natural disaster or trauma last struck. According to Dr Vivek Ullattil, a psychiatrist from Ernakulam, over the past two months, most of his cases are related to anxiety stemming from the floods. He points out, “With the start of the monsoon, their anxieties, which were suppressed for a year, are coming out. They are anxious about whether the dams be opened again and if there will be human loss.” His cases, he says, can be categorised into those of people directly affected by the floods, those who have an anxious personality and always consider the worst-case scenario and thirdly, people who have a family history of anxiety disorder or depression. “The monsoon triggers their stress,” he says. Dr Jaico Paulose, who was actively involved in the flood relief activities at Thiruvalla, explains that panic attacks and PTSD affect not just adults, but also children. “The shock is imprinted in children who tend to replay the moments when they had to leave their homes in a hurry due to the waterlogging. It is also very important to address the concerns of children who were trapped inside the house while the water level was rising, as they will be more stressed out.” Pointing to some cases that came to his hospital at Thiruvalla, Jaico says it is essential for the public to have proper awareness on the mental health issues that one can have after being exposed to extreme life events. “In the event of a panic attack, one experiences intense anxiety and accompanied by a rapid heartbeat. So, they quickly head to the cardiologist. Most of the chest discomfort cases we see at our casualty are in fact, just those who suffer panic attacks, which can cause them to feel that they will die right the next moment,” he explains. The levels of stress can be classified into mild, moderate and severe. Mild and moderate stress can be treated through non-pharmacological treatments. Vivek says, “If it is in mild form, one should try to divert their attention by listening to music or taking up an activity or hobby. But if you feel it is going to be difficult to control, you should seek help. Most of the time, minor attacks can be handled by a strong social support system. People who live alone and have no support base will be more prone to panic attacks, so create a strong support system. Everybody becomes anxious and panics in such a situation but when it is excessive and if you feel it is affecting how you live and function, you need to take help.” If it is severe and is affecting their sleep, appetite, relationship and work, they must take counselling or medication. “Many people who come to us feeling mentally disabled, then go on to lead successful lives after identifying their condition as a panic attack. Once they identify this, we teach them to live through the panic attack by prescribing them some relaxation exercises and so on,” says Jaico. But doctors warn against ignoring the symptoms as it may cause major problems. Jaico adds, “Those who have not taken help will avoid going out and prefer to stay inside, as they could be suffering from anticipatory anxiety. They will also confine to their safe zone which is called acrophobic disorder. Once it is cured, they will be free mentally and will be able to face life better.” For children the trauma lingers. Their stress level depends on the reaction of the adults at home. “So, the cure can be done together,” he says. Who is vulnerable to PTSD?1. Those who have been suffering from depression, anxiety disorder, panic disorder or even mood disorder 2. Those who have experienced trauma earlier 3. Those who are mentally vulnerable 4. Depending upon the nature, severity and duration of calamity, people who aren’t suffering the above can also be prone to PTSD SymptomsIf the below symptoms persisting for a month and leads to significant distress and functional impairment, you have PTSD 1. Negative changes in mood and cognition – emotional numbing, shame, guilt, feeling of alienation, inability to recall key details, patchy memory loss, irritability etc 2. Recurrent intrusive memories about the incident or flashback 3. Traumatic nightmares 4. Re-experiencing things you saw or heard during the trauma 5. If you are ignoring people, things and places related to the trauma 6. Alternative arousal and reactivity problems – you may get hyper-aroused or less aroused 7. Some become hyper vigilant, excessively irritable, restless, sleep deprived, disoriented Helpline DISHA 24*7 service- 0471-2552056 Methods to deal with PTSD1.Talk it out 2. Slowly shift to good conversations 3. Exercise 4. Find distractions 5. Find a new hobby 6. Take help if above measures doesn’t work Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil.
